main event: Bright lights or stars observed in the sky in Monroe, Louisiana. They were described as being similar to Castor and Pollux but very bright and very large.
interesting points: The objects were described as half-dollar shaped, reddish in color, and appeared to be suspended downward from the center of a stream of light.
The objects accelerated and decelerated, performing various maneuvers.
Several weather balloons were released from Barksdale Air Force Base a few hours prior to the sighting, which may have contributed to the observation.
The observer was reported to be a man of some means and a reliable source.
The approving officer concluded that the objects sighted were likely a continuation of the moon rising and weather balloons.
sighted object: Bright lights or stars, half-dollar shaped reddish objects
